pages.title: Keybinding 101
pages.text: Minecraft is not always helpful about providing good keyboard shortcuts --- especially when there are a lot of mods installed all competing for hot key combinations.$(br2)The trick is to start simple and then only add what you need.

Two mods in particular are worth clearing some space in order to have keyboard shortcuts available:$(br2)$(o)SophisticatedBackpacks and JourneyMap$()$(br2)With that in mind the best start you can make $(o)is to go through and remove every key binding that you are not going to use$()

This is as simple as going down the list of key bindings and; for each one you do not want or do not even know/care what it does, click the button for it (if it is set) and hit $(l)ESC$().$(br2)If it changes to $(o)Not Bound$() you are all set.$(br2): )

So - when you are ready hit $(l)ESC$() to bring up the menu and click on $(l)$(o)Options...$() then $(l)$(o)Controls...$() then $(l)$(o)Key Binds...$()$(br2) -- and then go down that list and clear out all the junk.
